definition: a place of security and comfort : refuge
examples: the … Loyalists found harbor in the same areas

definition: a part of a body of water protected and deep enough to furnish anchorage, one with port facilities
to give shelter or refuge to
to be the home or habitat of, contain sense 2
examples: a town that harbors several textile factories

definition: to hold especially persistently in the mind : cherish
to take shelter in or as if in a harbor

examples: parasites that harbor in the blood
